                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>

                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>

                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"

                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>

                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>

                            </gmd:role>
                        </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Fox Point Lake Water Quality Monitoring Committee was appointed by the Municipality of the District of Chester in
  2014, in response to ongoing concerns about the water quality of Fox Point Lake and the Aspotogan Ridge development
  project in Mill Cove, NS. Aspotogan Ridge will be a 550-acre family lifestyle community, with the construction of over
  500 residential units and an 18-hole golf course planned over the next several years. Residents of Fox Point Lake have
  documented several siltation run-off events in the lake during construction of the golf course, leading to concerns over
  the impacts of the development project on the health of Fox Point Lake and its drainage basin.

  The Water Quality Monitoring Committee was tasked with developing a Water Quality Monitoring Program to document the
  baseline water quality conditions of Fox Point Lake and track any changes in the health of the lake over the course of
  the development project. In 2015, Bluenose Coastal Action Foundation was contracted to develop this monitoring program,
  provide training and assistance to a group of volunteers, and to analyze and report on the water quality results of the
  initial monitoring period and subsequent years. Monitoring of the lake and its inlet and outlet streams has taken place
  from May to October of each year since 2015.

  This program is funded by the Municipality of the District of Chester and the Aspotogan Heritage Trust and supported by
  a dedicated group of volunteers.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

                codeListValue="onGoing">onGoing</gmd:MD_ProgressCode>

                        <gco:CharacterString>Coastal Action, the program's volunteers, Aspotogan Heritage Trust, the Municipality of Chester, and their associates and partners are not liable for the accuracy and usage of this data.</gco:CharacterString>
                    </gmd:useLimitation>
                    
                </gmd:MD_LegalConstraints>
            </gmd:resourceConstraints>
            
            
            <gmd:language>
                <gco:CharacterString>eng</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:language> 
            
            
            <gmd:topicCategory>
                <gmd:MD_TopicCategoryCode>inlandWaters</gmd:MD_TopicCategoryCode>
            </gmd:topicCategory>

                            </gmd:westBoundLongitude>

name: 10-25976-p1wt-1520
notes:
The Fox Point Lake Water Quality Monitoring Committee was appointed by the Municipality of the District of Chester in
  2014, in response to ongoing concerns about the water quality of Fox Point Lake and the Aspotogan Ridge development
  project in Mill Cove, NS. Aspotogan Ridge will be a 550-acre family lifestyle community, with the construction of over
  500 residential units and an 18-hole golf course planned over the next several years. Residents of Fox Point Lake have
  documented several siltation run-off events in the lake during construction of the golf course, leading to concerns over
  the impacts of the development project on the health of Fox Point Lake and its drainage basin.

  The Water Quality Monitoring Committee was tasked with developing a Water Quality Monitoring Program to document the
  baseline water quality conditions of Fox Point Lake and track any changes in the health of the lake over the course of
  the development project. In 2015, Bluenose Coastal Action Foundation was contracted to develop this monitoring program,
  provide training and assistance to a group of volunteers, and to analyze and report on the water quality results of the
  initial monitoring period and subsequent years. Monitoring of the lake and its inlet and outlet streams has taken place
  from May to October of each year since 2015.

  This program is funded by the Municipality of the District of Chester and the Aspotogan Heritage Trust and supported by
  a dedicated group of volunteers.

notes_translated.en:
The Fox Point Lake Water Quality Monitoring Committee was appointed by the Municipality of the District of Chester in
  2014, in response to ongoing concerns about the water quality of Fox Point Lake and the Aspotogan Ridge development
  project in Mill Cove, NS. Aspotogan Ridge will be a 550-acre family lifestyle community, with the construction of over
  500 residential units and an 18-hole golf course planned over the next several years. Residents of Fox Point Lake have
  documented several siltation run-off events in the lake during construction of the golf course, leading to concerns over
  the impacts of the development project on the health of Fox Point Lake and its drainage basin.

  The Water Quality Monitoring Committee was tasked with developing a Water Quality Monitoring Program to document the
  baseline water quality conditions of Fox Point Lake and track any changes in the health of the lake over the course of
  the development project. In 2015, Bluenose Coastal Action Foundation was contracted to develop this monitoring program,
  provide training and assistance to a group of volunteers, and to analyze and report on the water quality results of the
  initial monitoring period and subsequent years. Monitoring of the lake and its inlet and outlet streams has taken place
  from May to October of each year since 2015.

  This program is funded by the Municipality of the District of Chester and the Aspotogan Heritage Trust and supported by
  a dedicated group of volunteers.
notes_translated.fr:
Le comité de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau du lac Fox Point a été nommé par la municipalité du district de Chester en
 2014, en réponse aux préoccupations persistantes concernant la qualité de l'eau du lac Fox Point et le développement de la crête d'Aspotogan
 projet à Mill Cove, en Nouvelle-Écosse. Aspotogan Ridge sera une communauté de 550 acres axée sur le style de vie familial, avec la construction de plus de
 500 unités résidentielles et un parcours de golf de 18 trous sont prévus au cours des prochaines années. Les résidents de Fox Point Lake ont
 a documenté plusieurs événements d'envasement et de ruissellement dans le lac pendant la construction du terrain de golf, suscitant des inquiétudes quant à
 les impacts du projet de développement sur la santé du lac Fox Point et de son bassin versant.

 Le Comité de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau a été chargé d'élaborer un programme de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau afin de documenter
 les conditions de référence de la qualité de l'eau du lac Fox Point et suivre tout changement de l'état de santé du lac au cours de
 le projet de développement. En 2015, la Bluenose Coastal Action Foundation a été chargée de développer ce programme de surveillance,
 fournir de la formation et de l'aide à un groupe de bénévoles, et analyser les résultats de la qualité de l'eau du
 période de surveillance initiale et années suivantes. La surveillance du lac et de ses cours d'eau d'entrée et de sortie a été effectuée
 de mai à octobre de chaque année depuis 2015.

 Ce programme est financé par la municipalité du district de Chester et l'Aspotogan Heritage Trust et soutenu par
 un groupe de bénévoles dévoués.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Fox Point Lake Water Quality Monitoring Dataset

title_translated.fr: Ensemble de données de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau du lac Fox Point
